result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:58 AM case called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Naum N Grodskiy appeared by video.  Attorney Rebecca Adams appeared by video for Naum N Grodskiy. There is a DAGP agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. State does not object to the bond modification requested by the Defense. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
Court accepts plea but withholds a finding of Guilt. A 12 month DAGP is filed with and accepted by the State. 
Anything else is dismissed and read in.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.
